snippet: In his most extensive remarks on race since 2008, President Obama spoke in personal terms about the experience of being a black man in the United States.
abstract: Pres Obama reads unusually personal statement offering his own reflections on acquittal of George Zimmerman in shooting death of Trayvon Martin and why the case has caused such pain among African-Americans; Obama's remarks are his most extensive on race since 2008.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR
byline.contributor: Jodi Kantor contributed reporting from Truro, Mass.

lead_paragraph: In his most extensive remarks on race since 2008, President Obama spoke in personal terms about the experience of being a black man in the United States.

headline.main: President Offers a Personal Take on Race in U.S.
headline.print_headline: President Offers a Personal Take on Race in U.S.
